description.narrative: The project's development objective is: To strengthen the capacity of the Ministry to effectively develop and execute policy,manageresources, and improve learning conditions for basic education.

condition.narrative: Annual ESSP Action Plan submitted and approved by Bank inc Procurement Plan for the upcoming financial year; and semi-annualprogress report 1 mth before AJR
Appoint a Ministry-led Capacity Building Steering Group within one month of project effectiveness and develop a MoEC strategicplanfor capacity building within 6 months of project effectiveness
Appoint a lead advisor for the work skills curriculum development activity not later than one month after project effectiveness.
Appoint a procurement specialist, a financial management specialist and a program facilitator not later than one month aftereffectiveness.
Maintain a financial management system and submit FMRs quarterly, no later than 18 days after the end of the quarter
Recipient shall maintain the AJR process as the primary vehicle for the review of and planning for MoEC's sector program

title.narrative: Enhanced quality learning materials for all primary and presecondary students and teachers

comment.narrative: Further information collection is proposed in development of learning material strategy on advice from Learning Materials advisor.

title.narrative: Satisfaction of Ministry and Development Partners with Annual Joint Review

comment.narrative: N/A: the High Level Meeting held in Fall 2009 was focused on the Strategic Plan and did not really constitute an AJR
No update – next AJR planned for Dec 2012

title.narrative: Improved work skills and attributes of pre-secondary school leavers
MoEC staff with improved skills to effectively contribute to sectormanagement and service delivery.

comment.narrative: Figure provided is initial rating of 'Category 1' (on-track or partially on-track) NESP Priority Program areas. ESSP Mid TermReview and individual activity reporting identify stronger areas of skills transfer to Ministry units. However with no baselineset in 2008, unit of measurement or average of Ministry Annual Action Plan performance this indicator has not been collected.Current preparation of the Management Strengthening Project proposes a Capacity Level framework for mentioning increasedfunctionality of units toachieve the NESP

title.narrative: Decline in shortfall of school furniture at the primary level

comment.narrative: school furniture funding (additional financing) not yet in place
The Ministry has allocated sufficient budget in FY 2013 to procure adequate number of furniture for primary and junior secondarylevel. Information about the exact number/volume has not yet available.

title.narrative: Number of additional classrooms built or rehabilitated at the primary level resulting from project interventions.

comment.narrative: Including the construction/renovation and maintenance supported by the ESSP AF II, the target could be achieved by the closingdateof AF II, 31 July, 2013.

title.narrative: All primary and pre-secondary school children and teachers receiving learning materials and teaching guides and the use of those materials in learning activities

baseline.value: Lafaek magazine distributed to all Timorese primary students

actual.value: Literacy and Numeracy learning materials are provided

comment.narrative: Lafaek was provided in 2009 and 2010 and then discontinued by the Ministry, to be replaced by locally-produced materials. TheProject provides Early Grade learning materials (for literacy and numeracy skills) Discontinuation of Lafaek support by Ministry;Learning Material advisor to strategy for learning materials for medium-term replacements.

title.narrative: In-place school siting, construction, rehabilitation and maintenance standards

baseline.value: All but school siting standards developed

title.narrative: In-place unit to support the procurement of learning materials and textbooks

comment.narrative: As the Ministry is now being restructured, the process of the LMU establishment is being discuss to ensure its fit with the neworganization structure. The step being taken now is training of three key staff.

title.narrative: Execution of at least two training contracts under the grant funding mechanism for post-secondary tutors
Utility of the learning assessment system
Percentage of Grade 3 students who can read with a fluency of at least 60 words a minute

comment.narrative: Updated EGRA data will not be available before the end of the project. The latest accurate measure is the 2009 EGRA study.
Figure represents 2011 PCR. 2012 figure to be updated/ being processed by EMIS unit of the MoE.
Improved data collection methods have led to apparent increases in GPI

title.narrative: Preparation of feasibility study for polytechnics
Policy and Legal Framework in place

target.value: Policy and Legal Framework in place

actual.value: Policy and Legal Framework in place

comment.narrative: NESP launched in July 2012 and now being implemented. A number of policy frameworks/ regulations are in place.

title.narrative: System for learning assessment at the primary level

comment.narrative: Two National Exams: EB Third Cycle National Exam; and General Secondary Year 3 National Exam
